explanation: [0-0] On a lit black gas stove, there is a thin piece of flatbread dough.

[0-2] Then, a tong covers the entire flatbread dough onto the gas stove. The dough puffs up as air fills inside. The scene switches to a black electric stovetop where a hand throws a piece of flatbread dough onto the hot surface. The scene then cuts to the flatbread on the stovetop emitting white smoke.

[0-2] Then, a tong covers the entire flatbread dough onto the gas stove. The dough puffs up as air fills inside. The scene switches to a black electric stovetop where a hand throws a piece of flatbread dough onto the hot surface. The scene then cuts to the flatbread on the stovetop emitting white smoke.

[2-4] The scene transitions to a white room. A young man in a white shirt sits at a wood-grain table, with white cabinets with wood grain visible behind him. The man picks up a piece of burnt flatbread with his right hand and lightly pinches it, breaking it in half. Frowning with disappointment, he throws the flatbread onto the table in front of him, implying it's impossible.

The man picks up a piece of burnt flatbread with his right hand and lightly pinches it, breaking it in half. [4-6] The scene changes. A hand holds a stick of butter and glides it across a frying pan's surface, leaving a thin layer of butter. The scene cuts to the same hand holding the butter, with the thin butter sheet still on it. A pair of blue scissors cut the butter sheet directly into the pan. The scene then shows the pan filled with many pieces of the cut butter, with a pair of chopsticks moving them around.

[6-9] The scene switches to a room with pendant lights. The man in white places a stick of butter on a blue cutting board. He then cuts a piece of butter with a knife and picks it up with a smile. The scene cuts back to the black stove with a frying pan on top. The camera focuses on the pan as a hand moves a piece of butter across the bottom. The scene transitions to show the melted butter turning into crispy, golden-brown bits. The crispy butter bits are then removed from the pan. The scene cuts back to the room with pendant lights, where the man in white holds a plate in his left hand and the crispy butter bits in his right. He looks resigned as he places the bits onto the plate, indicating it's impossible.

[9-11] The scene changes again. In a room with a blue background, a white electric baking pan sits on a table, filled with colorful gummy candies. A hand closes the pan. After a while, the pan is opened, revealing that the gummy candies have disappeared. As the top and bottom plates of the pan are separated, the candy strands inside are stretched out. The pan is fully opened, and the candy strands cool down. A hand gathers and pulls the solidified candy strands.

[9-11] The scene changes again. In a room with a blue background, a white electric baking pan sits on a table, filled with colorful gummy candies. A hand closes the pan. After a while, the pan is opened, revealing that the gummy candies have disappeared. As the top and bottom plates of the pan are separated, the candy strands inside are stretched out. The pan is fully opened, and the candy strands cool down. A hand gathers and pulls the solidified candy strands.

[11-14] The scene transitions back to the room with the pendant lights. The man, now wearing a blue shirt, sits in front of a small electric baking pan. He places a hamburger-shaped gummy candy into the pan, followed by a hot dog-shaped one and a donut-shaped one. He firmly closes the pan. A moment later, the gummy candies melt. The man opens the pan with concentration but finds that the result is not what he expected. With a straight face, he releases his grip on the pan, letting it close again, implying it's impossible.

[14-17] The scene changes, with the man's face appearing in the lower right corner. A round object with hollow patterns falls from above and lands in a dish filled with water. A watermark reading "Swimming Painting Art Teaches You to Shoot Slow Motion" appears above the man's head. As the object falls into the dish, water passes through its hollow patterns, creating long, thin strands that shoot upwards. The water around the object forms rings that rise up. The man in the lower right corner watches with wide eyes.

[17-21] The scene transitions back to the room with pendant lights. The man, now wearing a camel-colored shirt, holds a meat grinder in his right hand and twists the locking ring with his left. He opens the ring, takes out the round object with hollow patterns, and happily holds it up to the camera. The scene changes to the man placing a deep blue bowl with a white rim in the sink and turning on the faucet to fill it with water. The scene cuts back to the room with the pendant lights. He stares at the bowl with a neutral expression, suggesting it's impossible.
